Built following the articles outlined [at angry](http://theangrygm.com/series/build-an-adventure-2/)

# Part 1 : Goalpost

__Goals__ :
- Design a one-shot D&D adventure for four, 2nd-level PCs

__Constraints__ :
- One session *preferred*
- Site-based
- Include at least *2* social interACTION encounters, *2* combat-style encounters, *2* puzzles
- GM-Generated PCs that suit the adventure

__Extra Sauce__ :
- Fit the adventure into the *AAA* campaign setting
- Especially if it ties into the villains plots

__Stats__ :
| Encounter Difficulty | XP Budget |
|-|-|
| Easy | 200 |
| Medium | 400 |
| Hard | 600 |
| Deadly | 800 |

# Part 2 : Plotting

- __Goal__: Recover an ancient relic from a holy site
- __Resolution__: The heroes claim the artifact and bring it to their organization or fall victim to the caprices of the temple's deity 
- __Motivation__: Successful heroes are promoted within an organization; those who fail are expulsed, forced to scrounge for themselves 
- __Incitement__: Deputy of the revolutionary gypsies appeals to the heroes desire to rise in the ranks. He assigns them the mission of the artifact that a mysterious benefactor would like for them to retrieve. He provides the heroes with a gift for the temple guardians to aid negotiations. 
- __Patron__: Scarred political figure in the anarchist movement
- __Climax__:
    - The heroes confront the deity of the temple and try to negotiate for the artifact it jealously guards
    - The heroes flee the collapsing dungeon, dealing with the retribution of the thwarted deity along the way
- __"Villain"__: The capricious deity, scornful, spiteful, &c.
- __Site__: Jungle temple, guarded by a tribe and the puzzling challenges within
